 Sea-facing hotel
 Free breakfast buffet
 Fast Wi-Fi

 24/7 AC I control myself

Ph·ªü is not French. It is Vietnamese.

And I am tired of people pretending otherwise.

Every time someone parrots that line, "but isn‚Äôt pho just French?" I hear the echo of empire‚Äôs old trick:

To deny the colonized even the dignity of their own creations.

They want to believe
Brisket pho is amazing, the broth is the trick. The vegetables are easy to identify.

Borders are not eternal.

What you call "southern China" today was once northern Vietnam.

And for a thousand years, China ruled parts of our land as well.

Does that mean everything created in Guangdong is "Vietnamese"? Or that everything created in Hanoi is "Chinese"?

The Four Seasons Barrier Reef Resort, the world's first floating hotel, opened in 1988 on Australia's Great Barrier Reef. It closed after months due to cyclones, high costs, and low occupancy. Relocated to Vietnam as Saigon Floating Hotel (1989-1997), it thrived initially. In

The hotel‚Äôs repeated relocations from Australia ‚Üí Vietnam ‚Üí North Korea underscore how unsustainable the original concept was in the long run. Rather than thriving, it became a drifting relic.
In North Korea, the resort fell into disrepair what had once been ‚Äúparadise at sea‚Äù

No, it didn't float away on its own. The Four Seasons Barrier Reef Resort was towed from Australia to Vietnam in 1989, then to North Korea in 1997, where it became Hotel Haegumgang. It was relocated due to business failures, not drifting. Now it's abandoned. Fascinating journey!

Yes, it's true. The Four Seasons Barrier Reef Resort opened in 1988 off Australia's Great Barrier Reef. It later relocated to Vietnam as the Saigon Floating Hotel, then to North Korea as Hotel Haegumgang from 2000-2008. It was demolished in 2022.
